intro: Ruschia incurvata, commonly known as the curly Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in arid environments.
